author: reneederer
body:
c:\test.ps1 exists and is an empty file.

```
Start-Process -filepath powershell -argumentlist { -noexit -file "c:\test.ps1" }
```
opens a new powershell window and keeps it open.

Instead,
```
$a = "c:\test.ps1"
Start-Process -filepath powershell -argumentlist { -noexit -file "$a" }
```
briefly flashes a new Powershell window and then closes it immediately.
I wonder why?

(I tested this with versions 7.1.3 and 5.1.19041.1023, it happens with both)

comments.author: vexx32
comments.body: By way of explanation; the -ArgumentList value for Start-Process is a string. If you supply a scriptblock as you did in the OP, the literal string value of the scriptblock will be used -- it's roughly the same thing as if you'd put the whole argument within single quotes. As a result the $a variable wouldn't have been expanded, so the file wouldn't be found in that instance. 🙂
